2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model common (1)

5.name: Md
5.range: e.g. Primo GEN24 6.0 Primo GEN24 10.0 Primo GEN24 10.0 208-240 Primo GEN24 3.0 Primo GEN24 3.6 Primo GEN24 3.8 208-240 Primo GEN24 4.0 Primo GEN24 4.6 Primo GEN24 5.0 Primo GEN24 6.0 208-240 Symo GEN24 10.0 Symo GEN24 3.0 Symo GEN24 4.0 Symo GEN24 5.0 Symo GEN24 6.0 Symo GEN24 8.0

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model inverter (11x)

6.name: AphB
6.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

7.name: AphC
7.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

8.name: PPVphAB
8.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

9.name: PPVphBC
9.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

10.name: PPVphCA
10.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

12.name: PhVphB
12.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

13.name: PhVphC
13.range: This data-point is supported/not-supported depending on the grid connection.

20.name: DCA
20.range: not supported if the inverter has multiple DC inputs current of DC-strings can be found in MPPT model 160

21.name: DCV
21.range: not supported if the inverter has multiple DC inputs current of DC-strings can be found in MPPT model 160

31.name: EvtVnd1
31.range: "Customer" event severity level bitfield   bit 0 -> Error   bit 1 -> Warning   bit 2 -> Info  This bitfield is composed as a superposition for the severity-levels of all currently active events on view level "Customer". If a bit is set it means that currently there is at least one active event with this severity level. Multiple bits can be set at once indicating several active events with different severity-levels.

32.name: EvtVnd2
32.range: "Technician" event severity level bitfield   bit 0 -> Error   bit 1 -> Warning   bit 2 -> Info  This bitfield is composed as a superposition for the severity-levels of all currently active events on view level "Technician" If a bit is set it means that currently there is at least one active event with this severity level. Multiple bits can be set at once indicating several active events with different severity-levels.  View level "Technician" is a superset of view level "Customer". This means that all events visible for view level "Customer" are also visible for view level "Technician".

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model nameplate (120)

4.name: DERTyp
4.desc: Type of DER device. Default value is 4 to indicate PV device.

5.name: WRtg
5.desc: Continuous power output capability of the inverter.

7.name: VARtg
7.desc: Continuous Volt-Ampere capability of the inverter.

9.name: VArRtgQ1
9.desc: Continuous VAR capability of the inverter in quadrant 1.

10.name: VArRtgQ2
10.desc: Continuous VAR capability of the inverter in quadrant 2.

11.name: VArRtgQ3
11.desc: Continuous VAR capability of the inverter in quadrant 3.

12.name: VArRtgQ4
12.desc: Continuous VAR capability of the inverter in quadrant 4.

14.name: ARtg
14.desc: Maximum RMS AC current level capability of the inverter.

16.name: PFRtgQ1
16.desc: Minimum power factor capability of the inverter in quadrant 1.

17.name: PFRtgQ2
17.desc: Minimum power factor capability of the inverter in quadrant 2.

18.name: PFRtgQ3
18.desc: Minimum power factor capability of the inverter in quadrant 3.

19.name: PFRtgQ4
19.desc: Minimum power factor capability of the inverter in quadrant 4.

21.name: WHRtg
21.desc: Nominal energy rating of storage device.

23.name: AhrRtg
23.desc: The usable capacity of the battery.  Maximum charge minus minimum charge from a technology capability perspective (Amp-hour capacity rating).

25.name: MaxChaRte
25.desc: Maximum rate of energy transfer into the storage device.

27.name: MaxDisChaRte
27.desc: Maximum rate of energy transfer out of the storage device.

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model settings (121)

4.name: WMax
4.desc: Setting for maximum power output. Default to WRtg.

9.name: VAMax
9.desc: Setpoint for maximum apparent power. Default to VARtg.

10.name: VArMaxQ1
10.desc: Setting for maximum reactive power in quadrant 1. Default to VArRtgQ1.

11.name: VArMaxQ2
11.desc: Setting for maximum reactive power in quadrant 2. Default to VArRtgQ2.

12.name: VArMaxQ3
12.desc: Setting for maximum reactive power in quadrant 3. Default to VArRtgQ3.

13.name: VArMaxQ4
13.desc: Setting for maximum reactive power in quadrant 4. Default to VArRtgQ4.

14.name: WGra
14.desc: Default ramp rate of change of active power due to command or internal action.

15.name: PFMinQ1
15.desc: Setpoint for minimum power factor value in quadrant 1. Default to PFRtgQ1.

16.name: PFMinQ2
16.desc: Setpoint for minimum power factor value in quadrant 2. Default to PFRtgQ2.

17.name: PFMinQ3
17.desc: Setpoint for minimum power factor value in quadrant 3. Default to PFRtgQ3.

18.name: PFMinQ4
18.desc: Setpoint for minimum power factor value in quadrant 4. Default to PFRtgQ4.

19.name: VArAct
19.desc: VAR action on change between charging and discharging: 1=switch 2=maintain VAR characterization.

20.name: ClcTotVA
20.desc: Calculation method for total apparent power. 1=vector 2=arithmetic.

21.name: MaxRmpRte
21.desc: Setpoint for maximum ramp rate as percentage of nominal maximum ramp rate. This setting will limit the rate that watts delivery to the grid can increase or decrease in response to intermittent PV generation.

22.name: ECPNomHz
22.desc: Setpoint for nominal frequency at the ECP.

23.name: ConnPh
23.desc: Identity of connected phase for single phase inverters. A=1 B=2 C=3.

25.name: VRef_SF
25.desc: Scale factor for voltage at the PCC.

30.name: WGra_SF
30.desc: Scale factor for default ramp rate.

31.name: PFMin_SF
31.desc: Scale factor for minimum power factor.

32.name: MaxRmpRte_SF
32.desc: Scale factor for maximum ramp percentage.

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model status (122)

4.name: PVConn
4.desc: PV inverter present/available status. Enumerated value.
4.range: Bit 0: Connected  Bit 1: Available Bit 2: Operating

5.name: StorConn
5.desc: Storage inverter present/available status. Enumerated value.
5.range: Bit 0: Connected  Bit 1: Available Bit 2: Operating

9.name: ActVArhQ1
9.desc: AC lifetime reactive energy output in quadrant 1.

10.name: ActVArhQ2
10.desc: AC lifetime reactive energy output in quadrant 2.

11.name: ActVArhQ3
11.desc: AC lifetime negative energy output  in quadrant 3.

12.name: ActVArhQ4
12.desc: AC lifetime reactive energy output  in quadrant 4.

13.name: VArAval
13.desc: Amount of VARs available without impacting watts output.

17.name: StSetLimMsk
17.desc: Bit Mask indicating setpoint limit(s) reached.

18.name: StActCtl
18.desc: Bit Mask indicating which inverter controls are currently active.
18.range: bits are set according to enabled controls in immediate controls model 123  Bit 0: FixedW  Bit 1: FixedVAR Bit 2: FixedPF

21.name: RtSt
21.desc: Bit Mask indicating active ride-through status.

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model controls (123)

7.name: WMaxLimPct
7.desc: Set power output to specified level.

8.name: WMaxLimPct_WinTms
8.desc: Time window for power limit change.

10.name: WMaxLimPct_RmpTms
10.desc: Ramp time for moving from current setpoint to new setpoint.

12.name: OutPFSet
12.desc: Set power factor to specific value - cosine of angle.
12.range: from -1.0 to nameplate.PFRtgQ1 and from nameplate.PFRtgQ4 to +1.0

13.name: OutPFSet_WinTms
13.desc: Time window for power factor change.

15.name: OutPFSet_RmpTms
15.desc: Ramp time for moving from current setpoint to new setpoint.

16.name: OutPFSet_Ena
16.desc: Enumerated valued.  Fixed power factor enable/disable control.

17.name: VArWMaxPct
17.desc: Reactive power in percent of WMax.

18.name: VArMaxPct
18.desc: Reactive power in percent of VArMax.

19.name: VArAvalPct
19.desc: Reactive power in percent of VArAval.

20.name: VArPct_WinTms
20.desc: Time window for VAR limit change.

22.name: VArPct_RmpTms
22.desc: Ramp time for moving from current setpoint to new setpoint.

23.name: VArPct_Mod
23.desc: Enumerated value. VAR percent limit mode.
23.range: 2: VAR limit as a % of VArMax

24.name: VArPct_Ena
24.desc: Enumerated valued.  Percent limit VAr enable/disable control.

25.name: WMaxLimPct_SF
25.desc: Scale factor for power output percent.

27.name: VArPct_SF
27.desc: Scale factor for reactive power percent.

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model mppt (160)

9.name: N
9.range: number of mppt trackers  +  2 * number of battery inputs  2 MPPT and 1 BATTERY => 4 repeating blocks

17.name: module/1/Tms
17.range: number of seconds since Jan 1st 2000 00:00 am

27.name: module/2/Tms
27.range: number of seconds since Jan 1st 2000 00:00 am

33.name: module/3/DCA
33.range: When the battery is discharged the data-points of the charge input are set to 0

34.name: module/3/DCV
34.range: When the battery is discharged the data-points of the charge input are set to 0

35.name: module/3/DCW
35.range: When the battery is discharged the data-points of the charge input are set to 0

36.name: module/3/DCWH
36.range: When the battery is discharged the data-points of the charge input are set to 0

37.name: module/3/Tms
37.range: number of seconds since Jan 1st 2000 00:00 am

43.name: module/4/DCA
43.range: When the battery is charged the data-points of the discharge input are set to 0

44.name: module/4/DCV
44.range: When the battery is charged the data-points of the discharge input are set to 0

45.name: module/4/DCW
45.range: When the battery is charged the data-points of the discharge input are set to 0

46.name: module/4/DCWH
46.range: When the battery is charged the data-points of the discharge input are set to 0

47.name: module/4/Tms
47.range: number of seconds since Jan 1st 2000 00:00 am

2.name: ID
2.desc: Well-known value. Uniquely identifies this as a sunspec model storage (124)

4.name: WChaMax
4.desc: Setpoint for maximum charge.  Additional Fronius description: Reference Value for maximum Charge and Discharge. Multiply this value by InWRte to define maximum charging and OutWRte to define maximum discharging. Every rate between this two limits is allowed. The inverter is not fully capable of transferring power as reported by this reference value. Note that InWRte and OutWRte can be negative to define ranges for charging and discharging only

5.name: WChaGra
5.desc: Setpoint for maximum charging rate. Default is MaxChaRte.

6.name: WDisChaGra
6.desc: Setpoint for maximum discharge rate. Default is MaxDisChaRte.

7.name: StorCtl_Mod
7.desc: Activate hold/discharge/charge storage control mode. Bitfield value.  Additional Fronius description: Active hold/discharge/charge storage control mode. Set the charge field to enable charging and the discharge field to enable discharging.

9.name: MinRsvPct
9.desc: Setpoint for minimum reserve for storage as a percentage of the nominal maximum storage.

10.name: ChaState
10.desc: Currently available energy as a percent of the capacity rating.

11.name: StorAval
11.desc: State of charge (ChaState) minus storage reserve (MinRsvPct) times capacity rating (AhrRtg).

13.name: ChaSt
13.desc: Charge status of storage device. Enumerated value.
13.range: 1: OFF 2: EMPTY 3: DISCHAGING 4: CHARGING 5: FULL 6: HOLDING 7: TESTING   The status TESTING is used during battery calibration or service charge.

14.name: OutWRte
14.desc: Percent of max discharge rate.  Additional Fronius description: Defines maximum Discharge rate. If not used than the default is 100 and WChaMax defines max. Discharge rate. See WChaMax for details
14.range: valid range -100.00% - +100.00%  Please note that this register has a scale factor in Register InOutWRte_SF, so for InOutWRte_SF = -2 the valid range in raw values is from -10000 to 10000.  Please be aware that setting an invalid power window will result in a modbus exception 3 (ILLEGAL DATA VALUE). Invalid power windows are all windows where condition: ((StorCtl_Mod == 3) AND ((-1) * InWRtg > OutWRtg)) evaluates to true. This can happen for example if two negative values are written into InWRtg and OutWRtg and both limits are activated by StorCtl_Mod = 3.

15.name: InWRte
15.desc: Percent of max charging rate.  Additional Fronius description: Defines maximum Charge rate. If not used than the default is 100 and WChaMax defines max. Charge rate. See WChaMax for details
15.range: valid range -100.00% - +100.00%  Please note that this register has a scale factor in Register InOutWRte_SF, so for InOutWRte_SF = -2 the valid range in raw values is from -10000 to 10000.  Please be aware that setting an invalid power window will result in a modbus exception 3 (ILLEGAL DATA VALUE). Invalid power windows are all windows where condition: ((StorCtl_Mod == 3) AND ((-1) * InWRtg > OutWRtg)) evaluates to true. This can happen for example if two negative values are written into InWRtg and OutWRtg and both limits are activated by StorCtl_Mod = 3.

16.name: InOutWRte_WinTms
16.desc: Time window for charge/discharge rate change.

18.name: InOutWRte_RmpTms
18.desc: Ramp time for moving from current setpoint to new setpoint.

19.name: ChaGriSet
19.range: 0: PV (Charging from grid disabled) 1: GRID (Charging from grid enabled)

21.name: WChaDisChaGra_SF
21.desc: Scale factor for maximum charge and discharge rate.

22.name: VAChaMax_SF
22.desc: Scale factor for maximum charging VA.

23.name: MinRsvPct_SF
23.desc: Scale factor for minimum reserve percentage.

24.name: ChaState_SF
24.desc: Scale factor for available energy percent.

25.name: StorAval_SF
25.desc: Scale factor for state of charge.

27.name: InOutWRte_SF
27.desc: Scale factor for percent charge/discharge rate.
